channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: £30k-a-year prostate cancer drug too expensive for NHS
item.description: The drug abiraterone cuts the risk of men dying within three years by a third, but tablets are only on the NHS for patients who've had chemotherapy or stopped responding to standard drugs.

item.title: Portland is 'war zone' during violent night of anti-police protests
item.description: Officials say Portland Police Bureau's North Precinct was set on fire early Friday morning following violent clashes between cops and protesters in the city overnight.

item.title: Black Broadway actor proudly buys 1820s slave-built house
item.description: Robert Hartwell, who has appeared in Hello, Dolly! and "Motown the Musical, posted a photo of his new home. The house, which is in Massachusetts, was presumably built by slaves.

item.title: Earl accuses interior design pair who inherited most of £33m family fortune of flogging his history
item.description: When Gloria Wesley (pictured), the Dowager Countess Bathurst, left most of her £33million fortune to a pair of interior decorators, it caused a major shock.

item.title: Hilarious new app shows how you'd look as the opposite sex
item.description: We challenged nine well-known faces to try it, and give their no-holds barred views about the results, including television presenter Ulrika Jonsson (pictured).

item.title: TUI cancels ALL flights to Florida until December because of new Disney World safety measures
item.description: TUI said Disney World's new coronavirus safety guidelines would 'significantly impact the holiday experience' of customers who are usually promised an 'enjoyable, relaxing and safe holiday'.

item.title: Elon Musk calls Jeff Bezos 'copy cat' as Amazon buys Zoox
item.description: Musk's critical tweet no doubt references the CEO's own ventures with the electric vehicle company, Tesla, which has been making its own self-driving vehicles and software for some time.

item.title: Ex-Post Office boss who dragged staff to court in IT scandal quits Church of England ethics job
item.description: Paula Vennells, 61 who was chief executive of the Post Office between 2012 and 2019, has taken a 'leave of absence' from the Church's ethical investment advisory group.

item.title: Thug threatens man at gunpoint with imitation firearm
item.description: Conner Preece,19, was filmed using an imitation firearm to threaten a man while Preece's accomplice searched the man's pockets before the pair sped off in a stolen car in Spoltt, Cardiff.

item.title: BBC Countryfile host John Craven urges gardeners to boycott peat compost to help the environment
item.description: TV presenter John Craven has urged gardeners to stop using peat compost in order to help the environment. Around three billion litres of the plant material ending up in our gardens every year.

item.title: Liverpool mayor slams football fans partying a second night
item.description: For a second night in a row crowds of fans flocked to the city centre to let off flares, chant and celebrate the title win, while ignoring social distancing measures.

item.title: What became of Elton John's vanishing ex-wife Renate Blauel and why she came back to haunt him
item.description: ALISON BOSHOFF: Renate Blauel has suddenly emerged from the shadows to start legal action against her former husband Elton John. What has caused her to break decades of silence?

item.title: North Korea's censors endorse JK Rowling's Harry Potter books for their pioneering spirit
item.description: The North Korean regime, led by supreme leader Kim Jong-un, is known for its tight control over what literature citizens can read.

item.title: Costa Corona? What's really riled locals is the tidal wave of rubbish, says ROBERT HARDMAN
item.description: ROBERT HARDMAN: For all the talk of a second wave of Covid-19, it was not the risk of killer germs which had infuriated the locals hereabouts yesterday. It was all the rubbish.

item.title: Explorer unearths photos showing Amazonian tribe making contact with outside world for first time
item.description: EXCLUSIVE. The pictures belong to Dr Jack Wheeler, who is originally from Southern California. He told MailOnline Travel that he discovered the images while clearing his loft during the lockdown.

item.title: Man helped smuggle 39 migrants who died in lorry into UK
item.description: Alexandru Hanga, 27, today accepted he was part of an international gang ferrying migrants into Britain. He appeared in the dock at Old Bailey and admitted his role in the smuggling scheme.

item.title: Primary school head suspended for criticising lazy teachers during lockdown doubles down on claim
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Star primary school headteacher Pauline Wood, from Grange Park in Sunderland, is under investigation for the comments she made on a local BBC radio station.

item.title: Asylum seekers at Glasgow hotel where knifeman stabbed six demonstrated over 'poor conditions'
item.description: Asylum seekers living in the Park Inn Hotel on West George Street had demonstrated against 'poor conditions' before the attacker, from Sudan, just 'went mad and attacked people around him'.

item.title: Europe drought fears as ground water low on satellite pictures
item.description: Europe is facing a potential shortage of water for the third year in a row as 2020 continues to be one of the warmest years globally.

item.title: Nurse, 24, returns from shift to find thugs had STRIPPED her car of nearly all of its parts
item.description: Nurse Demi Murphy, 24, who works at Birmingham Heartlands Hospital, found the driver's window of her Toyota Aygo smashed and the front of the vehicle totally stripped by thugs.

item.title: Manchester lockdown partiers 'had been at BLM family event nearby earlier in day with no trouble'
item.description: The region's deputy mayor confirmed that officers had supported a nearby council-sanctioned family event on Roseberry Street in Moss Side, which ended between 7pm and 8pm.

item.title: How many of the 18k lockdown breach fines were in your area?
item.description: UK police bosses warned Brits need to take 'more personal responsibilities' as the number of tickets handed out in the two weeks to June 22 fell to their lowest level.

item.title: UK Islam convert got 'cold feet' over threat to blow up St Paul's
item.description: Muslim convert Safiyya Amira Shaikh, a 37-year-old mother from Hayes in west London, kept 'having doubts' about going through with the plot.

item.title: Syrian man dies days after his friend drowned trying to save him
item.description: Mohammed Al Safadi has died after two men got into difficulty in a stretch of water called Lulle Brook, which is connected to the River Thames in Berkshire, on Tuesday evening.

item.title: Spacewalking astronaut loses mirror outside the ISS, adding to 'space junk' in orbit around Earth
item.description: A spacewalking astronaut added to the millions of pieces of junk orbiting the Earth on Friday, losing a small mirror as soon as he stepped out of the International Space Station for battery work.

item.title: RSPCA blasts family for dragging kitten on 200-mile round trip Bournemouth beach in 92F temperatures
item.description: The RSPCA criticised a family for bringing their kitten on a 200-mile round trip to a packed Bournemouth beach on the hottest day of the year, as temperatures hit 92F degrees on Thursday.

item.title: Man jailed for killing flatmate he suspected of kissing girlfriend
item.description: Colombian Carlos Velez, 20, dreamed of being Britain's next fashion icon while living with his lover Ashlly Rondon-Diaz, 20, and chef David Martinez, 26, in Leyton, east London.

item.title: Animal rights activists glue themselves to road in London
item.description: Animal rights activists glued themselves to the streets of central London on Friday in a protest against farm trespassing fines in Canada under the Ontario Bill 156 Bill.

item.title: Facebook to label content from politicians that could be harmful
item.description: Zuckerberg said in a Facebook Live video on Friday that the company would begin labeling harmful content from politicians that remains 'newsworthy'.

item.title: Alcoholic mother-of-three gave up booze to get her family back
item.description: Seija Nelson, 38, began drinking heavily in 2014 when she moved from the suburbs of Chicago to the Denver Metro area.

item.title: Russian buys £6m London penthouse after virtual viewing
item.description: The sale of the three-bedroom apartment at the Lincoln Square development near Lincoln's Inn Fields was conducted 'virtually' in one of the biggest transactions of its kind during lockdown.

item.title: Beaches are turned into seas of hippy crack canisters
item.description: The Prime Minister has warned of a 'serious spike' in coronavirus infections in the UK if people do not follow social distancing guidance before the lockdown is eased on July 4.

item.title: Bar manager says Ron Jeremy 'a groper' but 'he's no rapist'
item.description: Eliot Preschutti, 46, was the bar manager at the legendary Rainbow Bar & Grill in West Hollywood where porn star Ron Jeremy would frequent.

item.title: Tennessee toddler found in CAGE surrounded by over 600 animals
item.description: Henry County Sheriff Monte Belew identified 46-year-old T.J. Brown, 42-year-old Heather Scarbrough and 82-year-old Charles Brown as the suspects.

item.title: Sadiq Khan 'promised to fast track controversial development'
item.description: The publisher and property developer said he had discussed plans to build the Westferry property development with Sadiq Khan during a celebration for the Queen's Birthday at the Albert Hall in 2018.

item.title: Bob Dylan's Rough And Rowdy Ways album hits number one
item.description: The singer and songwriter, 79, has also broke two chart records with Rough And Rowdy Ways.

item.title: Security camera captures moment cartel ambush Mexico City's police chief, killing two cops
item.description: Security cameras recorded the moment Gunmen armed with .50 caliber sniper rifles got ready to fire at an SUV transporting Mexico City's public security chief Friday morning.

item.title: Angela Merkel: UK to 'live with consequences' of no-deal Brexit
item.description: German Chancellor Angela Merkel announced Britain will have to 'live with the consequences' of a distant relationship with the European Union in the event of a no-deal exit.

item.title: Workplace gender bias sceptics more likely to promote men
item.description: Experts from Exeter conducted an experiment where managers in a profession with a high proportion of women as employees were asked to evaluate fake workers.

item.title: Robert Jenrick facing official probe in 'cash-for-access' row as Boris Johnson comes under pressure
item.description: Labour today reported the Housing Secretary to the Parliamentary Commissioner for Standards to investigate whether he breached the code of conduct for MPs.

item.title: Ex-Ocado driver caught with 10kg amphetamines haul jailed
item.description: The drugs were driven from Haberdashers' Aske's Independent school in Hertfordshire to an address in Watford where they were put into a van. Clive Latter, 61, was jailed for 34 months.

item.title: Average UK adult has £598-worth of unused gadgets in home
item.description: These forgotten gems may not stay so precious, however, as smart phones, tablets, computers, and consoles have depreciated by some 20 per cent in the UK market in the last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Doctor debunks claims face masks inhibit breathing
item.description: Dr. Megan Hall, a pediatrician in South Carolina, shared her experiment on Facebook. She measured her oxygen levels & heart rate while mask free and wearing two kinds of masks.

item.title: Katy Perry's preacher parents sell $20 motivational face masks
item.description: Katy Perry's evangelical preacher parents, Keith and Mary Hudson, are selling $20 face masks with messages 'I Can, I Will, 'Faith' and 'Believe'.

item.title: Decision on summer holidays will be taken TODAY: Boris Johnson expected to approve air bridges
item.description: The Government's coronavirus committee, led by Michael Gove, will meet this afternoon to decide which countries will have the 14-day quarantine restrictions lifted.

item.title: Sky News cuts off ex-Met Police chief
item.description: Anchor Adam Boulton challenged Kevin Hurley and suggested it was unhelpful to view violence through the prism of race - before later cutting him off entirely when the former top brass was in full flow.

item.title: Is the Union Flag on Boris' plane upside down?
item.description: Enthusiasts said they thought the Union Flag on its tailfin had been done upside down as Boris Johnson's official aircraft took off from Cambridgeshire yesterday (pictured).

item.title: Woman claims she has a foolproof way to see if jeans fit WITHOUT trying them
item.description: In a TikTok video, Billie Newland, an influencer and fashion blogger from Iowa, said you can check the waist size with your forearm and the leg length with your wingspan - but many aren't convinced.

item.title: Woman, 23, with allergy to WATER is unable to shower due to agonising pain
item.description: Rachael Fetter, 23, from Idaho, was diagnosed with Aquagenic Urticaria - an allergy to water - in July 2019 after she began developing painful hives every time she washed her hands.

item.title: Protesters from Seattle's CHOP confront construction workers and lie down in front of bulldozers
item.description: Construction workers arrived at CHOP in Seattle on Friday at 6am to remove the concrete and wooden barriers that have been set up around the zone.

item.title: 'Anti-drugs' woman died after taking cocaine for first time
item.description: Devoted mum Hannah McGurdy, 35, spent years telling friends and family about her feelings towards the use of drugs, before a drunken night in Cheadle, Greater Manchester led to her death.

item.title: Elderly woman dies in hospital five days after she was 'randomly' attacked from behind
item.description: Officers said Rosemary Hill was attacked from behind on Warren Road in Reigate, Surrey, at 5.40pm on Sunday.

item.title: The SAGE files: One in 20 Covid-19 patients is infectious after 14 days, report finds
item.description: SAGE scientists urged ministers to be clear about the threat level of Covid in a report handed to No 10 on May 26 - days before Boris was accused of sending mixed messages about the alert level,

item.title: Sophie Wessex helps volunteers at charity shop as she continues volunteering efforts amid COVID-19
item.description: Sophie Wessex, 55, who is patron of Shooting Star Children's Hospices, has spent time helping volunteers at the charity's Weybridge charity shop, which re-opened earlier this week.

item.title: Drama to show Boris Johnson's handling of UK coronavirus crisis
item.description: The drama will start at Boris Johnson's appointment as Prime Minister and focus on his handling of the coronavirus pandemic, including Mr Johnson falling ill with the virus.

item.title: British butterflies are at risk of being wiped out by farming as conservation measures fail
item.description: Conservation efforts around the margins of agriculture are not enough to protect all of the UK's rare species which are suffering from pollution and climate change, experts said.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak try out smartphone ordering and 'one-metre plus' social distancing
item.description: After chaotic schemes on beaches including Bournemouth yesterday he and Rishi Sunak dropped in on Pizza Playground near Canary Wharf to show how restaurants should work.

item.title: Cottage that appeared on Goodnight Mister Tom and the Vicar of Dibley goes on sale for £795,000
item.description: A chocolate box cottage in Turville, Buckinghamshire, a popular filming location for television shows like the Vicar of Dilbey and Goodnight Mister Tom has gone on sale for £795,000 this week.

item.title: Backpack and laptop of missing schoolboy Noah Donohoe found
item.description: Noah Donohoe has been missing from his South Belfast home since Sunday evening, when he fell off his bike while out for a ride, took off all his clothes and vanished.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could statins reduce risk of death?
item.description: Doctors are desperate for more weapons in their arsenal to treat Covid-19, which has killed almost 500,000 people worldwide in just six months. Only one drug has been proven to work so far.

item.title: The world's oldest person? China claims its most senior citizen has celebrated her 134th birthday
item.description: Chinese government news outlets claim that Almihan Seyiti, reportedly to be 134, is the most senior citizen in the country, though the authenticity of her birth records remains to be verified.

item.title: India admits massing troops on border with China
item.description: India says 'large numbers' of troops have been deployed in the disputed Galwan Valley, but said it was forced to send reinforcements after China increased the size of its own garrison.

item.title: Game of Thrones: Potential 2021 release date for new novel
item.description: George R. R. Martin revealed in a blog post that he was writing much faster in recent months thanks to his quarantine in a cabin. He even suggested his next book could arrive in 2021.

item.title: Angry viewers call for boycott of Maxine Peake over 'anti-Semitic' George Floyd link
item.description: Viewers have called for Maxine Peake to be boycotted over linking of George Floyd's death to the Israeli Secret Service. It came as Britain's biggest Jewish voice declared it was anti-Semitic

item.title: Cannabis-smoking motorcyclist jailed over hit-and-run
item.description: Jerome Cawkwell, pictured, rode a motorbike with defective front brakes when he ran into nine year old Max Clark in Hull on May 25. Cawkwell severed the youngster's foot and rode away after the crash.

item.title: Sky presenter Jacquie Beltrao reveals 'much nastier' new breast cancer
item.description: Former Olympic gymnast Jacquie Beltrao, 55, who lives in South West London, said she found a 'tiny lump' during lockdown and went straight to doctors who found it was a grade-three cancer.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 43,414 with 186 new fatalities
item.description: Department of Health data shows the daily toll is 7.5 per cent higher than the 173 recorded last Friday, amid mounting fears the UK could be rocked by a second wave of Covid-19 as lockdown eases.

item.title: Iranian spy jailed for plot to assassinate Danish dissident
item.description: Mohammad Davoudzadeh Loloei, a 40-year-old Norwegian with Iranian heritage, was arrested in October 2018. He took photos of the home of an Iranian exile in Denmark.

item.title: Scientists teach mice to smell an odour that doesn't exist
item.description: In experiments on mice, US neuroscientists generated an electrical signature that was perceived as an odour in the brain's smell-processing centre, the olfactory bulb.

item.title: Raccoon reaches paws through wooden deck to steal kittens' food
item.description: Two small kittens were taken by surprise when a cheeky raccoon began poking its hands through the decking and helping itself to their food in Dothan, Alabama.

item.title: Former F1 boss Bernie Ecclestone says 'black people are more racist than white people'
item.description: Bernie Ecclestone, the former chief executive for Formula One Group, said he was 'surprised' that Lewis Hamilton was upset by racism. The billionaire also said removing statues was 'stupid'.

item.title: Coronavirus killed TWICE as many factory workers and security guards as doctors and nurses
item.description: Men working in factories died at a rate of 73 per 100,000 men between March 9 - almost a fortnight before lockdown - and May 25, followed by men working as bouncers or security (72).

item.title: Man charged with murder after Birmingham dad stabbed to death
item.description: Father of one Reece Adamson, pictured with his daughter Amory, right, was described as a 'doting dad' by his family, who paid tribute to the 30-year-old who was stabbed to death in Birmingham on Sunday.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO warns second wave could kill millions
item.description: Dr Ranieri Guerra, an assistant director-general for strategic initiatives at the WHO, said the pandemic had so far spread as health officials had anticipated.

item.title: Neil Ferguson admits breaking lockdown to see lover 'wrong'
item.description: The shamed scientist, nicknamed 'Professor Lockdown' because his grim modelling convinced ministers to shut the UK down, said: 'I should have followed the rules and I regret that.'

item.title: Labour's Corbynite left-wing warn Keir Starmer 'you'll regret this'
item.description: The new Labour leader faced Mr Corbyn in a crunch meeting with at least 12 members of the hard-Left Socialist Campaign Group this morning after initially refusing to see them at all.

item.title: Teenager who threw boy, 6, from Tate Modern jailed for 15 years
item.description: Jonty Bravery, 18, has been jailed for at least 15 years for attempted murder when he threw a six-year-old boy from the Tate Modern viewing gantry.

item.title: Teenager, 19, reveals challenges she faces baking with Tourette's syndrome
item.description: Jade O'Connell, 19, from New Zealand, has Tourette's syndrome and shared a YouTube video of her baking a pavlova with her family which has racked up 77,000 likes and over 2,000 comments.

item.title: Archbishop of Canterbury says Church must think again about portraying Jesus as white
item.description: Graca Machel said: 'I believe even it might be much more positive to keep them because you are going to tell generations to come "this is how it started and this is how it should never be."'

item.title: Coronavirus China: State newspaper punished for outbreak report
item.description: Authorities have censored The Beijing News on Chinese twitter-like Weibo since Thursday after some of its reports on Beijing's coronavirus outbreak were labelled 'misleading and taken out of context'.

item.title: Coronavirus China: State newspaper punished for outbreak report
item.description: Authorities have censored The Beijing News on Chinese twitter-like Weibo since Thursday after some of its reports on Beijing's coronavirus outbreak were labelled 'misleading and taken out of context'.

item.title: Finance boss is jailed for more than four years after stealing nearly £3million from his bank
item.description: Simon Olver, 42, started defrauding Credit Industriel et Commercial Bank just under a year into his job. The finance boss, from Surrey, was yesterday jailed for four-and-a-half years.

item.title: Children whose parents have degrees feel more stressed at university
item.description: A new study by the University of Bochum, Germany, looked at levels of the stress hormone cortisol in the hair of women starting their first year at university.

item.title: Black Lives Matter activist 'lost a testicle after being shot with a rubber bullet fired by LAPD'
item.description: South African native Bradley Steyn, who was involved in anti-apartheid protests in South Africa when he was younger, claims the LAPD are responsible for his injuries on May 30.

item.title: Shopping centre owner Intu collapses into administration
item.description: The owner of Manchester's Trafford Centre made the announcement today as the company failed to secure a debt repayment holiday from its creditors.

item.title: Former policeman jailed after arrest by paedophile hunters
item.description: Phillip Thompson was ambushed at home in Royton, near Oldham, Gtr Manchester and detained in a citizen's arrest which was streamed live on social media.

item.title: Coronavirus Sweden: Expert slams WHO for 'misinterpreting data'
item.description: Anders Tegnell, Sweden's top virus expert, said world leaders caved to public pressure with measures that 'fly in the face' of science as he accused the WHO of 'misinterpreting' Swedish virus data.

item.title: Greg Rutherford wife Susie Verrill apologises after racist tweets are uncovered
item.description: Susie Verrill, 31, the wife of the retired British track and field athlete, 33, took to her Instagram highlights to apologise for 'adding to the social acceptance of minorities being marginalised'.

item.title: The moment doomed Pakistan Airbus scraped along runway after pilots 'forgot' to put wheels down
item.description: The airliner plunged into a residential neighbourhood in Pakistan's capital city in May after its pilots aborted an initial landing attempt. Pictured: The plane skidding on the runway at Karachi Airport.

item.title: Rebecca Adlington's ex-husband Harry Needs talks about his bisexuality
item.description: Harry Needs has given his first interview since coming out as bisexual last week.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Home antibody tests finally being trialled
item.description: Ministers promised Brits would be able to get pregnancy-test style blood kits to tell them whether they've ever had the virus back in March. But three months down the line, they still haven't materialised.

item.title: Isle of Wight festival to press ahead in August with strict coronavirus safety rules for revellers
item.description: Great Wonderfest in the Isle of Wight announced it will go ahead this summer with safety measures in place. Festival-goers will be able to stay overnight in 'safely spaced' tents over the bank holiday weekend.

item.title: 'Baby brain' is only a blip and new mums regain full cognitive function within a year, study shows
item.description: Researchers from the US found that so-called 'baby brain' is short-lived and that mothers are often more attentive than women who have never been pregnant or had children.

item.title: Woman has cared for 'vegetative state' father for 15 years
item.description: Dedicated Li Qin from China quit her job as a manager of a company to be the sole carer of her sick parent, who is in a vegetative state. She says she feels lucky to have him as her father.

item.title: The School That Tried To End Racism: Asian pupils 'not noticed'
item.description: Pupils from South and East Asian backgrounds are seen being separated into a third focus group during an experiment on the second episode of The School That Tried To End Racism in London.

item.title: More than four in 10 Brits say they have ENJOYED the lockdown
item.description: Of the 43 per cent who reported positive lifestyle changes, more than half (56 per cent) said they were able to spend more quality time with loved ones they live with, according to the ONS.

item.title: Amazon's video platform Twitch is rocked by sexual harassment claims
item.description: A chorus of women say the website bought by US giant Amazon for $970million in 2014 is a lair for perverts and sex abusers who make unwanted advances online and in person.

item.title: Inside New York's Hamptons in the coronavirus era with a stay at Baron's Cove hotel in Sag Harbor
item.description: New York's wealthy elite can breathe a sigh of relief, because their vacation playground - the Hamptons - is up and running again.With a few coronavirus tweaks. As James Gordon discovered.

item.title: Find out if your Isa pot matches up to your peers
item.description: HMRC has published a stash of data giving people the chance to discover how their Isa stash compares with people all over the country.

item.title: Bag a designer bargain! Charity shops are flooded with secondhand gems post-lockdown
item.description: There are already a bundle of designer bargains to be had at DEBRA stores, with locals donating items ranging from Michael Kors shoes to Diane von Furstenberg dresses.

item.title: Siege of Italy's coronavirus ghetto enters its second day
item.description: Some 700 residents were placed in total lockdown for 15 days this week in the complex in Mondragone - 60km north of Naples - where 49 people tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Are doctors better at treating Covid-19? Uk's death rate has FALLEN to a quarter of peak level
item.description: Analysis by Oxford University shows that 6 per cent of people admitted to hospitals in England with the virus died at the beginning of April. But now just 1.5 per cent of patients die from Covid-19.

item.title: Idris Elba says he 'experiences racism as often as he breathes'
item.description: During the live-streamed discussion about the Black Lives Matter movement and the arts, Idris explained that his success has not 'negated' his experience of racism

item.title: Don't rock the boat! Gentle 35ft humpback whale 'plays' with fishermen as it glides under the hull
item.description: Colin Sutton and his friends Reed Gunderson and David Reed were surprised to see a 35ft-long humpback whale play alongside their boat for around 45 minutes in the Sea of Cortez, Mexico.

item.title: NASA releases incredible 10-year time lapse of the Sun
item.description: NASA has released an incredible video showing a 10-year time lapse of the Sun in glorious 4K. The video shows a photo of the Sun for every day of the last 10 years per second.

item.title: Bolton primary school head threatens to cancel lessons over Zoom if parents don't stop swearing
item.description: Bolton headteacher Martin Johnson has warned primary school pupils not to wear crop tops to virtual lessons and reminded parents not to swear in the background of Zoom classes.

item.title: Solicitor, 55, is struck off after using nearly £5,000 of her clients' money to buy jewellery
item.description: The Law House director Eilish Adams admitted moving £1 million worth of customer payments to other customers' accounts to 'balance the books' in a fraudulent scheme known as 'teeming and lading'.

item.title: Air pollution in London rising to pre-pandemic levels
item.description: Air pollution levels in London, Paris, Rome and other European cities have all bounced back as a result of coronavirus lockdowns being eased, a new report says.

item.title: Kate Middleton is 'a bit like Prince Philip,' royal biographer claims
item.description: Royal biographer Penny Junor compared Kate Middleton's relationship with Prince William to Prince Philip and the Queen. Speaking to People, she said she 'doesn't outside' William.

item.title: Hilarious moment jealous golden retriever Sterling tries to stop his owner cuddling a toy dog
item.description: Diane Newton, from Toronto, Canada, wanted to see how her dog Sterling would react if her son Tyler, 24, cuddled a toy dog.The jealous pooch jumped all over him and yapped to get his attention.

item.title: Savvy mum reveals genius £4 trick which makes squash last TWICE as long
item.description: Stephanie Palin, 40, from Cheshire, has told how her family's supply of squash lasts twice as long after she bought coffee syrup pumps from Amazon for £4 and fitted them to the squash bottles.

item.title: Photographer captures hilarious moment adorable dogs attempt to catch treats
item.description: Liz Gregg, 47, from Herne Bay in Kent has perfected a technique of capturing the canines at their funniest moment naming the project Snap Catch.

item.title: Artificially intelligent humanoid robot 'Erica' nabs lead role in $70 million Hollywood sci-fi movie
item.description: The electric leading lady is understood to have shot her first scenes for the movie in Japan last year - with the rest of the film scheduled to be shot next year.

item.title: Woman, 28, is told she has TWO wombs
item.description: Kelly Fairhurst, from Essex, pictured with her partner Joshua Boundy, 34, and their children Agyness, four, and Margo, three, discovered she had two wombs when she underwent a scan.

item.title: Violence on Britain's beaches as two men are stabbed at beach rave and
item.description: A mass brawl involving more than 100 youths on the beach at Ogmore-by-Sea in Bridgend has been described as a 'contagion of stupidity' by South Wales' Police and Crime Commissioner.

item.title: Police chiefs warn pubs will be 'apocalyptic' on July 4 amid fury over Saturday bar reopening
item.description: Forces have begun cancelling leave and bolstering public order units in anticipation of widespread drunken disorder when lockdown is officially lifted on July 4.

item.title: First pictures of former Army soldier accused of mowing down and killing father and his two children
item.description: David Logan (pictured), 47, allegedly mounted the pavement on the outskirts of Dalton-in-Furness, Cumbria, on Sunday afternoon and crashed into the family before hitting a tree.

item.title: Mayor quits after comparing BLM protesters jumping on police car to monkeys at safari park
item.description: Peter Kraus, former major of Pembroke Dock, Wales, shared a Facebook post to his page on Monday which appeared to liken an image of black protesters to a photograph of monkeys at a safari.

item.title: Body-Klopping! Liverpool manager hilariously cuts loose with some dad-dancing
item.description: The German manager was delighted after finally ending Liverpool's 30-year wait to be crowned English champions with Chelsea's win over Manchester City on Thursday the deciding blow for the Reds.

item.title: Two drug dealers are executed as four other traffickers are put on death row in China
item.description: The Hainan Intermediate People's Court handed out the decisions at a group trial this week. Two were ordered to be executed right away while the other four received suspended death sentences.

item.title: Isis fanatic, 35, who urged German Jihadi terror cell to commit 'mass murder' is jailed for life
item.description: Fatah Mohammed Abdullah (pictured), 35, from Newcastle, was sentenced at the Old Bailey to concurrent life sentences with a minimum term of nine years.

item.title: Mayor Sadiq Khan announces £110m police cuts just hours after Met chief vows illegal rave crackdown
item.description: Mayor Sadiq Khan made surprise announcement hours after Metropolitan Police Commissioner Cressida Dick vowed to crack down on London's illegal after speaking with Home Secretary Priti Patel

item.title: Japan has 'some suspicions' about health of Kim Jong-un and his 'very strange movements'
item.description: Defence minister Taro Kono revealed his county's concerns at a press conference on Thursday, the 70th anniversary of the start of the Korean War. Pictured: Kim before he disappeared.

item.title: The big push back to the office: Bus and train timetables at '85% of pre-Covid levels' from July 4
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps today revealed that bus and train services will be geared up to 85 per cent of pre-pandemic levels from July 4 and July 6 respectively.

item.title: Psychic medium, 62, wins £50,000 payout after trip over sunbed on £4,000 luxury Mauritius holiday
item.description: Psychic medium Lynn Morgan, 62, developed a fear of falling after tripping over a sunbed on a luxury Mauritius holiday. She has now won over £50,000 compensation after suing travel operator Tui

item.title: Police seize £100,000 cash and luxury watches in south London drugs raid
item.description: The raids took place on a series of addresses, mostly in Wandsworth, south London, and come as part of the latest bust from police trying to crack down on drugs operations in the capital.

item.title: Britain's longest Covid-19 sufferer is released from hospital
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Keith Watson, 52, spent 95 days in hospital having been hit by Covid-19 in March. His wife and family were warned twice by medics that he was likely to die.

item.title: 'Lost' Qing dynasty vase that sat forgotten for 60 years is set to sell for $9MILLION
item.description: The Harry Garner reticulated vase was re-discovered by Amsterdam-based art consultant Johan Bosch van Rosenthal after it lay undiscovered in a woman's cupboard.

item.title: Fern Britton praised after telling beach-goers to clean up after themselves
item.description: Fern Britton, 62, has been praised by This Morning viewers for urging visitors to Cornwall's beaches to clear up after themselves, after images emerged of beauty spots strewn with litter.

item.title: Fern Britton speaks about the breakdown of her 20-year marriage to Phil Vickery
item.description: Appearing on Friday morning's instalment of Lorraine on ITV, Fern, 62, explained she 'needed the rest' which was forced on her by lockdown

item.title: Four Britons punished after breaking lockdown to go drinking in Singapore
item.description: Neil Buchan, Perry Blair, James Beatt, and Joseph Poynter, went to three bars selling takeaway alcohol in Singapore in May, before standing in the street drinking and smoking in violation of lockdown.

item.title: Woman who murdered and buried her friend was 'flirty and playful' with police officers
item.description: In the new Crime+Investigation series Murder Masterminds, prosecution lawyer Bridgette Jenson says Ashley McArthur, 41, from Florida was 'flirty and playful' with police.

item.title: UK's first covid-secure beauty salon gives a look inside
item.description: Owner of London salon Threads & Co -show Matt Bartell has revealed to FEMAIL what one of the UK's first Covid-secure salons will look like once allowed to re-open after lockdown is lifted.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham 'face months of construction near their £6million Cotswolds home'
item.description: The 100-space underground car park has been planned by an unnamed nearby business, according to The Sun .

item.title: Jools Oliver recalls her heartbreaking miscarriages in touching tribute to husband Jamie
item.description: In a lengthy and impassioned caption, Jools, who has been with Jamie, also 45, for 27 years, lauded her 'best friend' and lamented 'losing their five little stars in the sky'.

item.title: Britain's most expensive villages revealed by estate agents Savills
item.description: The exclusive data removed any areas where there were fewer than 20 sales in the last five years and features homes from Bedfordshire to Worcestershire.

item.title: People share the things they ordered online that did not come as expected
item.description: People from all over the world have shared examples of hilarious online shopping fails that left them in stitches in a Bored Panda gallery, including tiny furniture and dodgy clip-on veneers.

item.title: White Sacramento woman punched in the face after TWICE calling a black woman the N-word
item.description: Shocking footage shows an unidentified middle-aged white woman making the racial slur at the younger black woman at a California 7-Eleven on Monday.

item.title: Can YOU spot the seagull in this busy blue sky? Tricky puzzle puts observation skills to the test
item.description: As Brits consider staycations this summer, a holiday-themed brainteaser has been designed to celebrate the start of the season. Puzzlers are challenged to spot a solo seagull.

item.title: Lady Colin Campbell claims Meghan Markle's biracial identity was 'welcomed' by the Queen
item.description: Lady Colin Campbell, 70, claims that Prince Harry 'wouldn't have been allowed to marry' a white Hollywood starlet, but Meghan's biracial identity worked 'unreservedly in her favour'.

item.title: King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands' niece, 18, is taking Instagram by storm
item.description: Countess Eloise of Orange-Nassau, 18, who is fifth-in-line to the Dutch throne, has racked up a following of 75,000 on Instagram, as royal fans rush to follow her adventures.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... dental surgery backlogs
item.description: 'My receptionist tells me you were complaining that I'm charging a Covid supplement?'

item.title: Sex addict sues video platform Twitch for $25million over 'too many scantily clad gamers'
item.description: Gamer and sex addict Erik Estavillo is suing Twitch after claiming that the gaming platform has too many 'scantily clad' players that led him to masturbate to the point that he hurt his penis.

item.title: Some men admit to keeping their old underwear for more than 20 YEARS, a new poll reveals
item.description: Clothing firm Tom Clinch conducted a poll, which found that the average British man only buys new pants once every five years. More than two in five men admitted their partners buy their pants.

item.title: Wirecard collapses with debts of more than £3bn in German scandal
item.description: Last week auditor EY refused to sign off Wirecard's 2019 accounts, forcing out chief exec Markus Braun (pictured) and leading the firm to admit £1.7bn of its cash probably did not exist.

item.title: Limit of 15 children per class will rise to more than 30 in plan to get lessons running in September
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson has proposed 'double bubbles' to increase primary school class sizes. The move will allow ministers to bypass opposition from teaching unions.
item.media:credit: Jacques Feeney | MI News & Sport Ltd
